intro: Ptilotus comatus, commonly known as the feathered flax or desert flax, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, characterized by its hardy, succulent stems and gray-green foliage. The plant produces small, pale blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its unique feature is the presence of silky, hair-like structures on the stems, which give it its common name. Ptilotus comatus is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
